articles.title: Nvidia’s Next-Generation AI Chip Rollout Slowed by Engineering Snags
articles.summary: Nvidia's rollout of its next-generation AI chips, specifically two advanced models from the Blackwell lineup, has been delayed due to engineering snags. The issues are prompting a rework of a version of the AI accelerator to ensure better compatibility with existing data center infrastructure designed for the earlier Hopper H100 chip. These delays are impacting Nvidia's efforts to extend its market dominance in AI computing.

articles.title: Billionaire Paul Singer Thinks AI Stocks Like Alphabet (GOOG) Are in a Bubble
articles.summary: Billionaire Paul Singer's Elliott Management believes that mega-cap AI tech stocks, including Alphabet (GOOG), are in a "bubble land," with Nvidia being "overhyped." The firm challenges the long-term viability and cost-efficiency of many AI applications, contrasting with other experts who see AI as a driver for growth in companies like Alphabet, despite its perceived bubble status. The article also touches upon a debate regarding whether the entire Magnificent Seven group is in a bubble or if only specific segments like chipmakers are overvalued.

articles.title: 3 Inverse ETFs to Take Advantage of the Downturn
articles.summary: This article discusses three inverse ETFs that investors can use to profit from a market downturn. It highlights the Direxion Daily NVDA Bear 1X Shares (NVDD), Direxion Daily Crypto Industry Bear 1X Shares (REKT), and ProShares Short QQQ (PSQ) as convenient ways to short specific stocks, sectors, or indices without the complexities of direct shorting or options. The author cautions against holding these ETFs for more than one trading session due to daily compounding effects.

articles.title: AMD to acquire server builder ZT Systems for $4.9 billion in cash and stock
articles.summary: AMD announced its plan to acquire server maker ZT Systems for $4.9 billion in cash and stock to expand its AI chip and hardware portfolio and bolster its competition with Nvidia. The acquisition aims to integrate ZT Systems' engineering expertise to accelerate the testing and deployment of AMD's AI GPUs for cloud computing giants, with AMD planning to divest ZT Systems' manufacturing business post-acquisition. The deal is expected to close in the first half of 2025 and contribute to AMD's adjusted financial performance by the end of 2025.

articles.title: 3 Inverse ETFs to Take Advantage of the Downturn
articles.summary: This article identifies three inverse ETFs that investors can use to profit from a market downturn. It discusses Direxion Daily NVDA Bear 1X Shares (NVDD), Direxion Daily Crypto Industry Bear 1X Shares (REKT), and ProShares Short QQQ (PSQ), highlighting their mechanisms and potential benefits for bearish investors. The author cautions about the daily compounding effect and advises limiting exposure to single trading sessions.

articles.title: Wall Street Just Got Its Most Volatile ETF as Risky Bets Boom
articles.summary: Defiance has launched the Defiance Daily Target 1.75X Long MSTR ETF (MSTX), a new leveraged ETF designed to offer daily returns on MicroStrategy Inc. This ETF is expected to be the most volatile in the US due to MicroStrategy's 90-day volatility of 97%, driven by its significant Bitcoin holdings. The emergence of such leveraged single-stock ETFs reflects a growing market for high-volatility products, attracting significant investor interest despite warnings from the SEC about their risks, particularly for retail investors.

articles.title: Humanoid Helpers of the Future
articles.summary: Morgan Stanley research predicts the humanoid robot market could reach a $357 billion impact on wages by 2040, expecting 8 million working humanoids in the U.S., rising to 63 million by 2050. These advanced robots, powered by generative AI, are seen as a solution to labor shortages, particularly in hazardous or repetitive industries, potentially disrupting 75% of occupations and 40% of employees with a $3 trillion payroll impact. The commercialization of humanoids is anticipated to accelerate faster than autonomous vehicles due to their ability to operate in controlled environments, presenting investment opportunities in their development and the underlying AI and mechanical components.

articles.title: Growth Beats Yield at This T. Rowe Price Mutual Fund
articles.summary: The T. Rowe Price Dividend Growth Fund (PRDGX) has lagged the S&P 500 over the past year due to its focus on dividend-growing companies rather than the mega-cap tech stocks that have driven market gains. Manager Tom Huber prioritizes companies with increasing dividends over high yields, anticipating a shift in investor attention towards dividend stocks as interest rates are expected to fall. He is currently investing in discounted sectors like consumer staples, energy, and healthcare.

articles.title: Should Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG) Be on Your Investing Radar?
articles.summary: This article examines the Vanguard Russell 1000 Growth ETF (VONG), a passively managed ETF focusing on large-cap US growth stocks. It highlights VONG's low expense ratio, significant exposure to the Information Technology sector, and strong performance over the past year. The piece also compares VONG to alternative ETFs like VUG and QQQ, making a case for VONG as an excellent option for investors targeting the Large Cap Growth segment.

articles.title: Which AI-Stock ETFs Are the Most Focused?
articles.summary: This article discusses thematic ETFs focused on Artificial Intelligence (AI) stocks, offering a potentially more direct but volatile way to invest in the AI boom compared to broad-based funds. It highlights two cardinal rules for choosing such ETFs: assessing theme robustness and thematic purity, using Morningstar Direct’s Consensus Purity Score as a key metric. The article evaluates several AI-focused ETFs, including the Robo Global Artificial Intelligence ETF, TCW Artificial Intelligence ETF, and Global X's Artificial Intelligence and Technology ETF, comparing their purity scores and performance track records.

articles.title: S&P 500 Gains and Losses Today: KeyCorp Stock Soars as Scotiabank Acquires Stake
articles.summary: The S&P 500 was largely flat on Monday, August 12, 2024, ahead of crucial economic data releases. KeyCorp shares surged significantly after Bank of Nova Scotia announced a $2.8 billion investment, while Albemarle shares fell due to declining lithium prices. Other notable movers included Super Micro Computer and Nvidia which saw gains, and Solventum and Warner Bros Discovery which experienced losses.

articles.title: The Zacks Analyst Blog Highlights PulteGroup, KB Home and M/I Homes
articles.summary: The Zacks Analyst Blog highlights PulteGroup (PHM), KB Home (KBH), and M/I Homes (MHO) as enticing buys due to plummeting mortgage rates. A significant drop in the average 30-year fixed mortgage rate, driven by expectations of a September Fed interest rate cut, is boosting the housing market. These homebuilders are expected to benefit from increased buyer purchasing power and robust demand.

articles.title: Bitcoin miner Core Scientific rides AI from bankruptcy to $6.7 billion partnership in eight months
articles.summary: Bitcoin miner Core Scientific announced a significant expansion of its AI business through a partnership with cloud provider CoreWeave, which is expected to add $6.7 billion in revenue over 12 years. This move highlights a growing trend among bitcoin mining firms to retrofit facilities for AI clients as crypto mining profitability declines. The company emerged from bankruptcy in January and its stock has since surged 140%.

articles.title: Should You Invest in the Fidelity MSCI Information Technology Index ETF (FTEC)?
articles.summary: This article evaluates the Fidelity MSCI Information Technology Index ETF (FTEC) as an investment option. It details FTEC's passive management, low expense ratio, top holdings like Apple and Microsoft, and strong performance, recommending it as a "Strong Buy" for investors seeking exposure to the Technology ETFs segment.

articles.title: 3 Robotics Stocks to Buy and Hold for the Potential of Huge Returns
articles.summary: This article identifies three robotics stocks—Teradyne (TER), ESAB Corporation (ESAB), and Novanta (NOVT)—as strong buy-and-hold candidates due to their robust fundamentals and growth potential. The author screens companies based on debt-to-equity ratio, return-on-equity ratio, and analyst ratings, highlighting how recent advancements in AI are making the robotics sector an increasingly attractive investment. The article details specific financial metrics, operational highlights, and strategic initiatives for each company supporting their long-term investment recommendation.
